meanings.definition: To swallow greedily or in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog was ingurgitating his food as if he hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent2: After the race, the runner was ingurgitating water to quench his thirst.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was ingurgitating his milk so fast, it seemed like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner ingurgitated all the crumbs on the floor in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to ingurgitate the entire rainfall in one swift motion.

meanings.sent1: The bear was ingurgitating the berries from the bush in the forest.
meanings.sent2: At the buffet, he was ingurgitating plate after plate of food.
meanings.sent3: The movie character was ingurgitating popcorn during the exciting scenes.
meanings.sent4: The black hole seemed to ingurgitate everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The student was ingurgitating information from the textbook before the exam.
